This is a quick guide of how to setup your environment to build and deploy DroidPlanner to your device using the source code. The basic three steps are:
* Clone the source [using GIT](https://github.com/DroidPlanner/droidplanner/wiki/Build-Setup---GIT). Or download a [snapshot](https://github.com/DroidPlanner/Tower/archive/master.zip) of the current state of the code (not recommended). 
* Install the development environment (IDE + Android SDK). By default the project is built with [Android Studio](https://github.com/DroidPlanner/droidplanner/wiki/Build-Setup---Android-Studio) running with Java 1.7+.
* Setup [Google Maps](https://github.com/DroidPlanner/droidplanner/wiki/Build-Setup---Google-Maps) API.

If you are having trouble, feel free to ping the developers on [gitter](https://gitter.im/dronekit/dronekit-android).
